text:
ce="preserve">The 65th British Academy Film Awards, more commonly called the BAFTAs, were held on 12 February 2012 at the Royal Opera House in London. Stephen Fry, who hosted from 2001 to 2006, returned to host the awards ceremony. "The Artist" won seven awards, out of its twelve nominations, including Best Director and Best Film. "Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy" was named Best British Film.
Winners and nominees.
Winners are listed first and highlighted in bold.
BAFTA Academy Fellowship Award.
Martin Scorsese
Outstanding British Contribution to Cinema.
John Hurt
